par.text: Ytterbium occurs naturally only in the combined state, most abundantly in monazite sand, which is a mixture of the phosphates of cerium, thorium, lanthanum and other lanthanides. These elements make up 50% of monazite sand by weight, while the ytterbium content is found to be about 0.003%. Ytterbium constitutes
crust by weight and ranks 43rd in abundance.
